page.title: 17TRAFFIC IN ST.HELIER
page.content: The volume of traffic in the town area is becoming a major cause for concern. The number of vehicles is increasing all the time (in 1981 there were some 36133 cars). Jersey has several unique traffic features. There is an all island speed limit of{40mph;}some junctions have a sign reading{Filter in Turn}which means you should take your turn with any other vehicles joining a stream of traffic. As in Britain we drive on the left, but the law says that drivers should give way to horses. The traffic lights have a different sequence with no amber light preceding the green. Another distinctive feature on Jersey roads is the number of cars which carry a{red H {plate}showing that they are hire cars. There are over 4,500 of these "horror" cars as the locals call them.
